pylovo
  • Pylovo GUI
  • Javascript API Reference
  • Network Editor
  • display_editable_network_features.js
  • View page source

display_editable_network_features.js

fillStdTypeList()

function creates options for each std_type select element in the GUI

fillStdTypeEditor(sel, listName)

displays the right std_types editor window and fills the input fields with the right values

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – HTML select element we want to fill

  • listName (string) – key of the std_type group

populateLists(listName)

fills html element with options for a given list of network features at intial editable network generation the index property of a feature and the option index do not have to match

Arguments:

  • listName (string) – key for accessing and setting html element ids

populateEditableNetworkEditor(listName, selectedProperties, std_typeList, std_type_properties)

The feature editor window template for all feature types gets filled at runtime input fields and labels depend entirely on the properties defined in the displayNetwork function

Arguments:

  • listName (string) – key for accessing and setting html element ids

  • selectedProperties (dict) – dict containing all properties of the feature for which we create the editor window

  • std_typeList (dict) – dict containing all std_types, only needed for keys here

  • std_type_properties (dict) – dict containing all properties of the std_type associated with the feature

populateEditableNetworkEditorSecondaryFeature(primaryFeatureName, secondaryFeatureName)

creates html elements for the secondary feature editor and adds select options for the secondary features

Arguments:

  • primaryFeatureName (string) – name of the primary feature (e.g. bus)

  • secondaryFeatureName (string) – name of the secondary feature (e.g. load)

addSecondaryFeature(primaryFeatureName, secondaryFeatureName)

onclick function for the Add Secondary Feature buttons. Adds a new secondary feature to the GUI and the network object

Arguments:

  • primaryFeatureName (string) –

  • secondaryFeatureName (string) –

openEditableNetworkList(e, listName)

gets called when one of the tablink buttons in the GUI gets pressed and opens the relevant feature list, while hiding all other GUI elements

Arguments:

  • e (event) – onclick event which triggered the function call

  • listName (string) – name of the list to be opened

fillSelectedEditableNetworkFeatureEditor(sel, listName)

writes values of the currently selected feature into the input fields of the editor window

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – the html select element whose onchange event triggered the function call

  • listName (string) – key for accessing data to be written into the editor windows

resetStyle(target, feature)

resets the styling of the previously selected feature and sets the new styling of the now selected feature

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) – leaflet map object whose style is to be changed

  • feature (string) – name of the target type (e.g. bus, line)

clickOnMarker(target, feature, drawModeOverride)
When clicking on a map element or making a selection from a list,

we highlight the relevant element, open the Editor window and fill its input fields with the relevant values

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) – leaflet map objects

  • feature (string) – name of the feature that was selected

  • drawModeOverride (bool) – if this is false, onclick events are not registered on map features while creating new features

openSecondaryEditor(sel, secondaryFeatureName)

onclick function for the Secondary Feature buttons in the editor window, opens the secondary feature editor window

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – the html select element whose onchange event triggered the function calls

  • secondaryFeatureName (string) – key for accessing he secondary feature data

writeBackEditedNetworkFeature(target, targetDiv)

onchange function for editor view. If a field is changed, its new value is written back to the relevant object

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) – the editor element that was changed

  • targetDiv (string) – the div in which the changed editor element resides

updateStdTypeFeaturesInEditor(id, feature)

if a new std_type is selected in an editor window of another feature, this function updates all input fields associated with the std_type

Arguments:

  • id (string) – name of the std_type

  • feature (string) – name of the feature for which the std_type was changed

createPopup(feature, layer)

Purely for debug atm, we will want to keep feature information within the markers themselves might be worth considering to display the editor window via the popup (visually too messy?)

Arguments:

  • feature (dict) – the feature for which we create a popup

  • layer (leaflet_layer_object) – the leaflet map layer we attach the popup to
